help.intro: This short guide will walk you through the basics of using the RevenuePilot app. Whether you’re creating your first clinical note or reviewing analytics, the app is designed to assist you at every step.
help.writing1: Use the Original Note tab to type or paste your draft clinical note.
help.writing2: The AI suggestion panel on the right will populate codes, compliance alerts, public health prompts, and differential diagnoses as you type.
help.writing3: When you’re ready to produce a polished version, click Beautify. A separate Beautified Note tab will appear with a cleaned, professional version of your draft. Your original text remains untouched.
help.writing4: Use the Copy button to copy the beautified note to your clipboard for pasting into your EHR or another system.
help.writing5: You can insert predefined templates from the dropdown in the toolbar (e.g., SOAP note, wellness visit, follow‑up). Selecting a template replaces your draft with the template content and lets you fill in the sections.
help.writing6: Enter a Patient ID in the toolbar to automatically save and reload drafts. RevenuePilot stores your draft locally under that ID, so you can return to finish documentation later.
help.analytics1: Click Dashboard in the toolbar to switch to the analytics view.
help.analytics2: The dashboard shows key metrics such as average revenue per visit, documentation deficiency rates, and provider confidence. These metrics will update as you use RevenuePilot.
help.analytics3: To return to your notes, click Back to Notes in the toolbar.
help.privacy1: RevenuePilot takes patient privacy seriously. Notes are de‑identified on your device before being sent to AI services; phone numbers, dates, addresses, emails and other identifiers are scrubbed to protect PHI.
help.privacy2: If you have any questions or encounter issues, please reach out to your project manager or support team for assistance.

logs.title: Event Log
logs.intro: This log shows recent actions captured by the app. Use it to verify that events such as note creation, beautification, suggestions, summaries, chart uploads and audio recordings are being logged and processed.

settings.title: Settings
settings.apiKeyHelp: Enter your OpenAI API key here. The key will be stored securely on your machine and used by the backend to call the language model. You can update it at any time.
settings.customRulesHelp: Enter one rule per line. These rules will be passed to the AI model to customise suggestions based on payer or clinic‑specific requirements.
settings.customRulesPlaceholder: e.g. Commercial payer X requires three ROS for 99214; Include time spent on counselling for CPT 99406
settings.promptTemplatesHelp: Edit JSON instructions or upload a file to customise prompts.
